Detailed Description

Use the usersearchrequest if:.

  • There might be a street number in the search string.
  • You require some kind of confidence sorting.
  • If you don't know / are unsure of what to use.

Called by SearchProcessor to decode search request packets.

Decodes a usersearchrequest and inits the parameters.

The parameters are similar to the vanillaserchrequestpacket except the one specified here.

Parameters:
nbrSortedHits The minimum number of sorted hits.
regionsInMatches The search region types or:ed together that should be in the reply matches.
topRegion The top region to perform the search in. Only applies when making an overviewsearch in SearchRequest.

Encodes the user serch request parameters into the packet The parameters are similar to those of a vanilla search request except the ones specified here.

Use some kind of best matches only sort if it is unlikely that the user is interested in matches far down in the match list. An example of this is an SMS client, capable of listing about 7 matches per SMS. By only requesting the first 28 hits to be sorted, the search module will be quick even if the user enters a stupid request, such as "m", matching 1000s of objects. Response time will be quicker, and the end user will probably not notice any difference.

Parameters:
sortingType The kind of sorting requested. All types of sorting are valid.
nbrSortedHits This specifies the number of matches to be sorted if the sortingType is such that all matches are not required to be sorted. For example, SEARCH_BEST_MATCHES_ONLY_SORT. The nbrSortedHits best matches are listed first, and then the rest are left unsorted.
nbrLocations The number of location string in locations.
locations A vector with strings describing locations.
locationType The type of locations to search for.
nbrMasks The number of masks in masks.
masks The vector with the masks limiting the search in the map.
maskItemIDs The item ids of the locations.
maskNames The names describing the masks.
editDistanceCutoff The cutoff to use when performing edit distance search. If set to 0, the default is used.
regionsInMatches The search region types or:ed together that should be in the reply matches.
topRegion The top region to perform the search in. Only applies when making an overviewsearch in SearchRequest.
categoryItem Name
bboxes 

const char* UserSearchRequestPacket::getSearchString (   )  const
 

Get the serarch string of this packet.

The pointer that is returned must not be deleted and will be invalid when this packet is deleted.

Returns:
The search string in this packet.
